film condensed: King & wife Coretta prepare for Nobel Prizegiving.
reality condensed: King went to Oslo to get a Nobel Prize.

film condensed: King presented with Nobel Prize.
reality condensed: King presented with Nobel Peace Prize.

film condensed: A church explodes, children die.
reality condensed: Ku Klux Klan bombed a church, killed 4 children.

film condensed: Cooper tries to register to vote, blocked by impossible test.
reality condensed: Cooper attempted to register at least 5 times, blocked.

film condensed: President Johnson awaits King's visit, he's annoyed with King's impatience.
reality condensed: Controversy over Johnson's view of King, but they worked together.

film condensed: King demands legislation to protect black right to vote, Johnson delays.
reality condensed: Johnson promised to do it eventually, but not yet.

film condensed: King heads to Selma.
reality condensed: King went to Selma.

film condensed: SCLC leader Bevel greets King.
reality condensed: Bevel worked with King in Selma.

film condensed: King is attacked by a white guy.
reality condensed: National States' Rights activist knocked King down.

film condensed: FBI director Hoover suggests discrediting King via his family.
reality condensed: Hoover went after King, taping his extramartial encounters.

film condensed: Coretta gets a threatening phone call.
reality condensed: The Kings received many such calls.

film condensed: Kings calls Mahalia Jackson, asks for a song.
reality condensed: King was enamoured by Jackson's gospel voice.

film condensed: King & SCLC leaders arrive at Richie Jackson's place.
reality condensed: Richie Jackson's home became unofficial HQ for the Selma movement.

film condensed: Jackson feeds everyone.
reality condensed: Richie Jackson's home became unofficial HQ for the Selma movement.

film condensed: The SNCC aren't happy that King has turned up.
reality condensed: Major tensions between the SNCC & SCLC.

film condensed: King incites local blacks to dem & their right to vote.
reality condensed: King gave a speech encouraging action.

film condensed: A journalist challenges King on his non-violent approach.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: SCLC leaders meet with SNCC leaders, discuss tactics.
reality condensed: The two groups agreed drama was needed.

film condensed: Protesters march peacefully to the courthouse.
reality condensed: King led 100 protesters to the courthouse.

film condensed: The protesters kneel.
reality condensed: The protest was a peaceful sit-in.

film condensed: Sheriff Clark hits Cager Lee, Annie Lee Cooper hits Clark, she's arrested.
reality condensed: Lee was attacked in nearby Marion. Cooper did hit Clark.

film condensed: King shown in jail.
reality condensed: King got himself arrested on purpose.

film condensed: Johnson watches Wallace speak out against desegregation.
reality condensed: Johnson viewed Wallace as an uncontrollable bigot.

film condensed: King is despondent.
reality condensed: King suffered moments of despondency.

film condensed: Malcolm X turns up. The SCLC are alarmed.
reality condensed: Malcolm X arrived in support of King.

film condensed: Coretta meets with Malcolm X.
reality condensed: They met in secret.

film condensed: Malcolm X persuades Coretta he's there to help.
reality condensed: Coretta felt optimistic they could work together.

film condensed: King was suspicious of Malcolm X, didn't like Coretta talking with him.
reality condensed: King deplored Malcolm X's violent approach.

film condensed: Wallace hatches a plan to kill the movement.
reality condensed: Wallace sanctioned planned violence against the protesters.

film condensed: Police kill lights, attack protesters. Jackson & family flee.
reality condensed: Police killed the lights to hide their violence from reporters. Jackson family fled.

film condensed: The cops find Jackson & family, shoot him dead.
reality condensed: The cops shot Jackson, but he died from his wounds several days later.

film condensed: King visits Cager Lee in hospital.
reality condensed: King visited Jackson & family in hospital.

film condensed: King gives a eulogy at Jackson's funeral.
reality condensed: The funeral speech sparked the Selma to Montgomery march.

film condensed: SCLC & SNCC leaders meet to discuss tactics.
reality condensed: They met frequently for strategy meetings.

film condensed: King informs Johnson of his intention to march, Johnson not happy.
reality condensed: King kept Johnson updated, Johnson's response contested.

film condensed: White warns King's people to keep King safe.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: King tells Johnson the cause won't wait for him.
reality condensed: They discussed legislation but we don't have details.

film condensed: Johnson brings Hoover in.
reality condensed: Johnson worked with Hoover, although to what extent is contested.

film condensed: Coretta is sent a recording, apparently of King having sex with someone else.
reality condensed: The FBI did mail incriminating tapes to Coretta.

film condensed: King agrees to stay home the first day of the march.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: Wallace condemns the march.
reality condensed: Wallace ordered extreme measures to prevent the march.

film condensed: Lewis & Forman argue about the march.
reality condensed: SNCC had reservations.

film condensed: The march begins.
reality condensed: Over 500 protesters marched across Edmund Pettus Bridge.

film condensed: State troopers await the protesters.
reality condensed: The troopers lined up to block the march.

film condensed: Bayard calls Young, tells him to turn on TV.
reality condensed: Footage from the march was broadcast on CBS.

film condensed: Troopers release tear gas & attack.
reality condensed: Troopers used teargas & nightsticks to attack protesters.

film condensed: 17m people watch events on the news.
reality condensed: Millions of people tuned in.

film condensed: Troopers knock Boynton to the ground.
reality condensed: A photo of Boynton's assault went global.

film condensed: Viewers glued to TV sets watch the violence.
reality condensed: Millions of people saw what happened via CBS.

film condensed: Lewis & Abernathy help Boynton up.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: People reconvene outside the chapel.
reality condensed: Marchers returned to the chapel.

film condensed: Young talks a man out of using a gun to retaliate.
reality condensed: The leaders discouraged violence.

film condensed: King ordered the second march following Bloody Sunday.
reality condensed: King organized a second march.

film condensed: King puts out a call to action.
reality condensed: King called for supporters to come to Selma.

film condensed: Minister James Reeb heads to Selma.
reality condensed: Reeb answered King's call, went to Selma.

film condensed: Judge Johnson won't allow the march without White House backup.
reality condensed: Judge Johnson was sympathetic, but wanted to wait for formal hearings.

film condensed: Johnson warns Wallace & King to stop.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: Lawyer Doar asks King to give up the march for his own safety. He refuses.
reality condensed: Doar urged King to postpone the march. SCLC leaders told him no.

film condensed: Hundreds gather, including Archbishop Iakovos.
reality condensed: Archbishop Iakovos joined the march.

film condensed: King addresses the crowd of black & white supporters.
reality condensed: Around a third of the protesters were white.

film condensed: Troops withdraw, the marchers kneel in prayer.
reality condensed: The troopers stepped aside & the marchers kneeled.

film condensed: King turns back, leads the marchers home.
reality condensed: King turned the marchers around to obey a federal injunction.

film condensed: SNCC & SCLC leaders argue about King's decision.
reality condensed: Only a few knew of the turnaround plan, others weren't happy.

film condensed: King sends his wife a letter.
reality condensed: King often wrote to his wife.

film condensed: White supremacists attack & kill Reeb.
reality condensed: Reeb was attacked by white men, died two days later.

film condensed: Johnson annoyed about sit-ins at The White House.
reality condensed: Seven Selma activists conducted a sit-in at The White House.

film condensed: King  & Lewis debate approaches.
reality condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film condensed: King goes to court to fight for the right to march in safety.
reality condensed: King went to court to get his march sanctioned.

film condensed: Judge Johnson grants the right to march unencumbered from Selma.
reality condensed: Judge Johnson overtuned Wallace's prohibiton of the march.

film condensed: Key leaders arrange for famous speakers to attend the march.
reality condensed: Some really big stars attended the march.

film condensed: Wallace informed Johnson is going over his head.
reality condensed: Johnson tried to work with Wallace but eventually went over him.

film condensed: Wallace & Johnson debate the issue.
reality condensed: Johnson urged Wallace to protect the marchers.

film condensed: Johnson announces his Voting Rights Bill.
reality condensed: Johnson demanded Congress pass his Voting Rights Bill.

film condensed: Doar implores King to nix his speech for safety.
reality condensed: Doar tried to protect King.

film condensed: Thousands march with military protection.
reality condensed: 8000 people joined the march, protected by police & military.

film condensed: Titles: Most activists went on to do well, some were killed. The Voting Rights Act got signed in.
reality condensed: Many activists got official posts, some were murdered. Johnson signed the Voting Rights Act.
